text: Abderrahmane Hammadi (; born 24 March 1984) is an Algerian former track and field athlete who specialised in the 400 metres hurdles. He competed internationally for Algeria between 2003 and 2011. He was the gold medallist at the 2011 All-Africa Games and the 2007 Pan Arab Games.Makori, Elias (2011-09-15). From Daegu to Maputo, Jeylan and Montsho rule! - All Africa Games. IAAF. Retrieved on 2016-08-23.Results November 2007 - Pan Arab Games. Athletics Africa. Retrieved on 2010-07-08. His personal best is 49.84 seconds, which is a former Algerian national record and set during a silver medal run at the 2008 African Championships in Athletics.2008 African Championships Results. TunisAthle. Retrieved on 2016-08-23. He was also the winner at the 2011 Arab Athletics Championships.Pan Arab Championships, Al Ain (United Arab Emirates) 26-29/10/2011. Africa Athle (2011-10-29). Retrieved on 2013-10-13. Hammadi began his international career with a bronze medal at the 2003 African Junior Athletics Championships and followed up with a senior bronze at the Islamic Solidarity Games two years later.African Junior Championships. GBR Athletics. Retrieved on 2016-08-23.Islamic Solidarity Games. GBR Athletics. Retrieved on 2016-08-23. He won his first Algerian national title in the 400 m hurdles in 2006.Algerian Championships. GBR Athletics. Retrieved on 2016-08-23.
